pros: It is a small school. Class schedules are published with professors' names next to course slots, so students who enjoyed a prof' class will often sign up for that prof again. I enjoyed knowing some of my students on a personal level.
cons: Administration doesn't run the school, it runs it into the ground. The last president was all appointed by the GA legislator: no candidate search, no hiring committee, no accountability to anyone except a handful of politicians. Read the SACS report for verification. Also, state employees in GA did not receive so much as a 1% cost of living allowance between 2007-2014.

pros: The students are great.  They are such a pleasure to work with.  Small college so you really get to know people.  Many staff and faculty are really enjoyable to work with.
cons: Administration heavy.  Admins get high salary, staff salary keeps getting cut.  A lot of turnover in administration.  Atmosphere can be negative at times.

review_title: Opportunities for professional development and advancement are possible.
pros: The institution is advancing. There are many positive possibilities for the future. The new President is very supportive. Great faculty. Students are awesome. Very nice place to work.
cons: Salaries seem to be lower than those in near-by Florida state schools. It appears that the USG primarily controls this.

pros: Great place to work and everyone is very nice. I had a very rewarding job as a tutor for academic services. I would recommend it to anyone.
cons: I do not think there are any cons to working for the College of Coastal Georgia. My experience there was great.

job_title: Bridget Bragg, RN, MSN in Brunswick, GA
pros: Excellent work environment.  Teamwork with Staff.  Excellent in devotion to students.
cons: I would prefer to keep my comments brief about Coastal Pines Technical College.  Poor work conditions along with disregard for student success.
